title: Backed up passwords through logins.json and key4.db not showing up in fresh install of Firefox
content:
Hello.

I freshly installed Windows and therefore Firefox, I backed up my Profile folder before doing so and I moved my logins.json and key4.db files to the new Profile of the fresh installatio. But my passwords don't show up in Firefox Saved Passwords, the files aren't corrupted as I can see my data when opening the logins file on Firefox, but the passwords are all encrypted. I have given up hope that firefox will recognize the passwords (I have created new profiles and moved the json and db file there multiple times, refreshed the browser, installed and older version, none of them seem to work for me). Is there any way to decrypt my passwords outside of Firefox? Or is there a fix to this problem that I am not aware of? I have searched the forums for hours, and people who decrypt the files outside of firefox seem to do it in ways that I am not capable of doing so (coding ,etc)

Would really appreciate any help as this is driving me crazy.
creator: android.batu

title: ESR 91 downloads files after it is blocked
content:
Hi 

  Anyone experiencing an issue with Firefox 91 ESR on Win10 with blocking downloads?  We have the desktop blocked with controlled folder access and a plugin loaded which stops downloads of most file types, but when clicked on, the box appears to save the file after regardless.  The user cannot select a file location, but if they just click save it saves to the desktop anyway.  Cannot seem to stop firefox doing this. Anyone know a fix ?

Thanks, 

      Jon Dickens

title: Text replacement or subsitution on MacOS is disabled in Firefox
content:
On MacOS (going back a long time) there is a very convenient feature (In Settings ⇒ Keyboards ⇒ Text) for "text substitution" or, as it appears in other applications' "Edit" Menus, under "Subtitutions", "Text Replacement".

For example, this lets me type, say (/), and have a ✔️ appear, or (r) for ®.

It may seem minor, and it is, but it's also a great time-saver when you have to do the same non-keyboard characters a lot.

This appears to be a simple thing to enable in MacOS applications. Where would I file a feature request for this?

(There have been at least 3 identical requests in the past 2 years, all archived.)
creator: larry_west
